file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 26-21-04-04 - ENGINE FIRE EXTINGUISHING BOTTLE CARTRIDGE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL ENGINE FIRE EXTINGUISHING BOTTLE CARTRIDGE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section contains the procedures to removal/installation the cartridges of the engine fire extinguishing bottle. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ENGINE FIRE EXTINGUISHING BOTTLE ALL 26-21-04-000-801-A CARTRIDGES - REMOVAL ENGINE FIRE EXTINGUISHING BOTTLE ALL 26-21-04-400-801-A CARTRIDGES - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 26-21-04 Page 1 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 26-21-04-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. ENGINE FIRE EXTINGUISHING BOTTLE CARTRIDGES - REMOVAL A. General (1) To do the task, refer to the instructions in Pacific Scientific CMM 26-20-202. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 71-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 26-21-02-000-801-A/400 ENGINE FIRE-EXTINGUISHING BOTTLE - REMOVAL Pacific Scientific CMM 26-20-202 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 312 312AR Tail cone compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Ladder To get access to the tail cone compartment 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Tail cone compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 71-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. (1) Remove the engine fire-extinguishing bottle (AMM TASK 26-21-02-000-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 26-21-04 Page 2 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal SUBTASK 020-002-A WARNING: THE CARTRIDGES ARE EXPLOSIVE DEVICES. ACCIDENTAL DETONATION OF A CARTRIDGE CAN CAUSE INJURY. DURING THE TASK OBEY ALL SAFETY PRECAUTIONS CONTAINED IN THE PACIFIC SCIENTIFIC CMM. (1) Remove the cartridges. Refer to the last revision of Pacific Scientific CMM 26-20-202. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 26-21-04 Page 3 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 26-21-04-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. ENGINE FIRE EXTINGUISHING BOTTLE CARTRIDGES - INSTALLATION A. General (1) To do the task, refer to the instructions in Pacific Scientific CMM 26-20-202. B. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation SUBTASK 420-002-A WARNING: • BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 71-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. • THE CARTRIDGES ARE EXPLOSIVE DEVICES. ACCIDENTAL DETONATION OF A CARTRIDGE CAN CAUSE INJURY. DURING THE TASK OBEY ALL SAFETY PRECAUTIONS CONTAINED IN THE PACIFIC SCIENTIFIC CMM. (1) Install the cartridges. Refer to the last revision of Pacific Scientific CMM 26-20-202. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the engine fire-extinguishing bottle ( AMM TASK 26-21-02-400-801-A/400).
